channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead fox on street, 4th November
item.description:
Another dead fox on grass verge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More waste dumped at flytipping hotspot, 4th November
item.description:
Here we have a filthy grey mattress, with cardboard boxes underneath it, plus what lools like wooden drawers alongside it. Note that the delivery details have carefully been scribbled out by the addressee, making it harder for you to identify the culprit. This flytip wasn't there when I walked past on Saturday afternoon, but I have no idea when it was done. Time to invest in CCTV for these hotspots. We pay you enough Council Tax to fund it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Clifton Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins / Unsanitary waste, 4th November
item.description:
Repeated problem with 3 bins around the corner of Tressilian avenue which overflow due to overuse from school children and not being emptied frequently enough. As the bins do not close the overspill falls out including dog mess, food and sanitary tools, which get blown over the pavement and into nearby driveways and door ways. A fox has also recently become resident which scavenges the bins making matters worse. This is extremely unhygienic and despite multiple reports to Enfield council asking to replace with closed bins nothing has been done for months and months

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tresilian Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised soft flooring / near opening of pyramid slide and by big swings, 4th November
item.description:
My 3 year old granddaughter tripped over this high raised flooring at the opening of the pyramid slide and again the edge of the big swing area cutting both her knees . This soft child safety flooring needs looking at on all the edges and open areas please before it becomes more serious than grazed knees .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
